project.title: Mentor — Machine Learning Intern — Framatome
project.description: Detailed project page for the Machine Learning Internship at Framatome: statistical analysis and machine learning applied to thermal loads in nuclear piping systems.
project.summary: Detailed overview of the Machine Learning Internship at Framatome: statistical analysis and machine learning applied to thermal loads in nuclear piping systems.

overview.text: This project focuses on analyzing thermal loads in primary loop piping systems in nuclear power plants. The goal was to apply data-driven techniques to model thermal stresses, detect patterns in operational data, and predict maximal stress locations using machine learning methods.

images.caption: Thermal loads on primary piping systems
Sample of operational data used for analysis
Sample of operational data used for analysis
Sample of operational data used for analysis

contributions.text: Parametrization of thermal loads based on operational data from sensors and historical records.
Clustering of thermal load patterns to identify recurring operating regimes using unsupervised learning techniques.
Prediction of maximal stress using supervised learning models, helping to anticipate potential failure zones.
Visualization of thermal patterns and stress predictions for engineers using advanced plotting techniques.
Development of Python scripts for automating preprocessing and analysis pipelines.

contributions_images.caption: Clustering analysis of thermal load patterns
Python scripts used for data automation

technical_details.title: Data Processing
technical_details.text: Raw operational data from nuclear piping systems was cleaned and normalized. Features such as temperature, pressure, and flow rates were extracted and prepared for analysis.

technical_details.title: Clustering Analysis
technical_details.text: Clustering algorithms such as K-Means and DBSCAN were applied to identify patterns in thermal load profiles. This enabled the classification of operational regimes for better understanding of stress variations.

images.caption: Heatmap showing clustering of thermal loads

technical_details.title: Stress Prediction
technical_details.text: Supervised learning models including Random Forest and Gradient Boosting were trained to predict maximal stress points based on operational conditions. Model performance was validated using cross-validation techniques.

images.caption: Machine learning models for stress prediction

outcomes: Efficient classification of thermal load patterns, improving predictive maintenance strategies.
Enhanced understanding of stress variations under different operating conditions.
Automated data analysis scripts reduced manual processing time by 50%.
Deliverables contributed to internal knowledge base at Framatome for nuclear piping analysis.
skills: Practical application of unsupervised and supervised machine learning in an industrial context.
Handling large-scale operational datasets and performing feature engineering.
Experience in creating visualizations for engineering decision support.
Improved coding skills in Python for data analysis and automation.
